message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.RO 

This paper deals with scene understanding using a latent variable model and computer graphics. The focus is on refining the model to better explain a given image. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) categories. The use of computer graphics and scene graphs also suggests the graphics (cs.GR) category. The approach of training a prediction network to directly update the latent variables is a novel optimization technique, which could also fall under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) category. Finally, the use of camera position and object appearance in the latent variables suggests a possible connection to robotics (cs.RO).
